comments:
2009 Celebrity Jeopardy!

From CES in Las Vegas, Nevada.

clues.clue: Mexico
France
Poland
The Philippines
Peru
This HBO series is loosely based on Mark Wahlberg's Hollywood experiences; if only my life were as exciting
This heiress said, "Having a nightclub in your house really helps for having a party"; that's hot
With ex-girlfriends like Lindsay Lohan & Mandy Moore, Wilmer Valderrama has come a long way since playing Fez on this sitcom
An on-the-town Mischa Barton got more time to pose for paparazzi after she left this teen soap in 2006
This celebutante has had romances with DJ AM & with rocker Joel Madden
In a Shaw play, she tells Caesar, "You must not be disrespectful to me, or the Sphinx will let the Romans eat you"
Meryl Streep has suspicions about Philip Seymour Hoffman in the film adaptation of this Pulitzer Prize winner
Stockard Channing sang "Bewitched, Bothered and Bewildered" in the 2008 revival of this musical
Sutton Foster was Broadway's "Thoroughly Modern Millie" before playing Princess Fiona in this musical
Tom Stoppard's drama "The Coast of" this ideal place was ideal indeed, winning the 2007 Tony for Best Play
A common type of this plains plant is the Russian thistle--let's go drifting along with the tumblin' these
Your lawn grass is always greener without this "roaring" yellow wildflower, Taraxacum officinale
Many low-growing herbs are common weeds called these, a term also used for a kind of tropical banana
This popular American beer used croaking frogs in a 1995 Super Bowl commercial
On this 1950s-set sitcom, these 2 young & wacky title women worked at the Shotz Brewery
This popular Irish beer bears the name of a classic Irish stringed musical instrument
Bob Marley's ghost could tell you that Red Stripe is a beer from this Caribbean country
The 2 words that precede "Less Filling" in slogans for Miller lite
An old military projectile, or a dive made with hands grasping knees
There's a legume in this word for a pitch hurled at a batter's head
In football a mighty kickoff into this area may result in a touchback
In 1983 Bonnie Tyler hit No. 1 singing, "Nothing I can do, a total eclipse of" this body part
This daughter of Aerosmith's lead singer played Arwen in "The Lord of the Rings"
He wrote, directed & starred in "Madea's Family Reunion"; he also had a "House of Payne"
This Food Network chef hosted "Food 911" & "How to Boil Water"
This 1988 William Hurt & Geena Davis film about a writer of travel guides was based on a novel by Anne Tyler

Goya,

This spiritual leader of Tibet has said, "My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness"
In 2008 we learned from Sarah Palin that "The difference between a hockey mom and a pit bull" is this
Sorry Beatles fans, he said he has "too much to do, so no more fan mail...& no objects to be signed"
This "In Cold Blood" author said, "Finishing a book is just like you took a child out in the yard & shot it"
She quipped, "In France cooking is a serious art form and a national sport"
The star Polaris is also known by this directional name
Castor and Pollux are the two brightest stars in this twinned constellation that's also a sign of the zodiac
The cluster of stars known as the Pleiades is also called the "Seven" these family members
The 2 brightest stars in the nearby constellation Centaurus are Beta Centauri & this one
Alnilam, Mintaka & Altinak are the 3 stars in his belt
Change these in your house to new more efficient ones that use 1/4 the energy & actually produce more illumination
Be wise with this kitchen appliance by putting it on energy-saver mode & making sure the door seals properly
Buy this kind of food, from the Latin for "instrumental", that's pesticide-free & often locally grown
In 2004 the EPA certified the Ford Escape as something that sounds contradictory, the first hybrid this
Your carbon one isn't made with your shoe but your lifestyle; calculate it at www.nature.org
You won't see Edyta Sliwinska performing this, done by Southwest Indians in August to bring precipitation

final_jeopardy.clue: Much of this 2001 movie remake was filmed at the Bellagio hotel in Las Vegas
